info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN, SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 645 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Ramon, or 32 miles east of Corona, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 146 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central, southeastern and east central New Mexico.
